titles.title: Providing for consideration of the concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 119) expressing the sense of Congress that a carbon tax would be detrimental to the United States economy.
Providing for consideration of the concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 119) expressing the sense of Congress that a carbon tax would be detrimental to the United States economy.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 115-834, by Mr. Newhouse.
Rule provides for consideration of H. Con. Res. 119 with 1 hour of general debate. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 169.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1001.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H.Res. 1001, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Mr. McGovern demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings on ordering the previous question on H.Res. 1001 until later in the legislative day.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 226 - 186 (Roll no. 339).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 229 - 183 (Roll no. 340).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 119) expressing the sense of Congress that a carbon tax would be detrimental to the United States economy.
